newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish brokerages' gross PLN 111.63 mln in Q1-Q3.
newsitem.headline: Polish brokerages' gross PLN 111.63 mln in Q1-Q3.

text.p: Polish brokerage houses grossed 111.63 million zlotys profit in the first three quarters of this year against a 36 million zloty gross profit in the whole of 1995 and 140 million in 1994, the Central Statistical Office said.
Total revenue of brokerages in the first nine months was 541.3 million zlotys of which income from broking and advising services accounted for 259.9 million zlotys.
"The main source of revenue for brokerages was the income from broking and advising services which almost doubled against last year," the Office (GUS) said in a report.
It said brokerage margins accounted for almost 70 percent of their revenue.
Out of the country's 50 brokerages 28 reported a gross profit in the first three quarters of this year and 22 reported a loss, GUS said.
It said brokerages' operating costs were 35.2 percent higher than in 1995 and after the first three quarters were at 429.6 million zlotys.
The number of accounts opened rose in the first nine months by 18.3 percent against 1995 to 976,900.
"The rise in the number of accounts can be explained by the transformation of the mass privatisation certificates into paperless form and a bullish bourse," GUS said.
